snippet: Members of the Sebago Canoe Club of Brooklyn spent a recent Friday night in kayaks, reveling in a darkness and tranquility not usually associated with New York.
abstract: Sebago Canoe Club meets once or twice a month depending on the lunar calendar for nighttime kayak paddles through Jamaica Bay; the club's members, mostly from Brooklyn and Queens, seem to appreciate the contrasts the paddle around New York City affords: urbanism and nature, solitude and camaraderie, light and dark (Series: Summer Nights).
lead_paragraph: Members of the Sebago Canoe Club of Brooklyn spent a recent Friday night in kayaks, reveling in a darkness and tranquility not usually associated with New York.

headline.seo: Kayakers Wait for the Moonlight on Jamaica Bay
headline.main: Waiting for Moonlight on Jamaica Bay
headline.print_headline: Waiting for the Moonlight On Jamaica Bay
